lexUnit.name: massage.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: rub (muscles or joints) with the hands so as to relieve tension or pain.

sentence.text: She exhaled deeply and massaged the back of her neck with one hand .
His collarbone ached , and he dug at it with his good arm , massaging the stiffness with his fingers .
Plummer replaced the receiver slowly , massaging his chin thoughtfully with his other hand .
Mr Stanforth massaged his sharp jaw with one finger , and looked thoughtful .
Massage the scalp gently before washing .
Add a few drops to your bath or massage the oil into your skin .

Just massage it on your hand .

Gently massage your scalp after removing the rollers , working fingers through the hair to loosen the curls .
Instead of replying , I massage the base of his neck .
` I gave her the kiss of life and massaged her heart .

He sat back and massaged his temples , his eyes closed .

Scott reached up and massaged his own shoulders as best he could .

Pressing her fingers to the knot of tension at the back of her neck , she massaged gently , then stretched her limbs to relieve some of her aching muscles .
He sat back and massaged his temples , his eyes closed .
